result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Jerome Poindexter

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Jerome Poindexter in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Michael Jerome Poindexter.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Alexander James Geocaris for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense has received discovery and is still in negotiations and requests a status date. Court grants request and adjourns case for a status. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Jerome Poindexter in court with Attorney Jason A Findling.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON. 
Court took judicial notice of the defendants 3 prior OWI convictions. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Sgt. A. Grochowski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
 No driving without a valid license.
 Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Franke, Branch 25.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Defendant Michael Jerome Poindexter in court with Attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Michael Jerome Poindexter not in court.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 07/14/2022@2:30pm
